name: CloudFormationDeleteStack
author: Oracle Web Services
helpMarkDown:
Please refer to [OCI CloudFormation User Guide](https://docs.OCI.Oracle.com/OCICloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/) for more information on working with OCI CloudFormation.

More information on this task can be found in the [task reference](https://docs.OCI.Oracle.com/vsts/latest/userguide/cloudformation-delete-stack.html).

####Task Permissions
This task requires permissions to call the following OCI service APIs (depending on selected task options, not all APIs may be used):
* cloudformation:DeleteStack
* cloudformation:DescribeStacks

inputs.name: OCICredentials
inputs.label: OCI Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specifies the OCI credentials to be used by the task in the build agent environment.

You can specify credentials using a service endpoint (of type _OCI_) in the task configuration or you can leave unspecified. If unspecified the task will attempt to obtain credentials from the following sources in order:

* From task variables named _OCI.AccessKeyID_, _OCI.SecretAccessKey_ and optionally _OCI.SessionToken_.
* From credentials set in environment variables in the build agent process. When using environment variables in the build agent process you may use the standard OCI environment variables: _OCI_ACCESS_KEY_ID_, _OCI_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY_ and optionally _OCI_SESSION_TOKEN_.
* If the build agent is running on an Oracle EC2 instance, from the instance metadata associated with the EC2 instance. For credentials to be available from EC2 instance metadata the instance must have been started with an instance profile referencing a role granting permissions to the task to make calls to OCI on your behalf. See [Using an IAM Role to Grant Permissions to Applications Running on Oracle EC2 Instances](https://docs.OCI.Oracle.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_use_switch-role-ec2.html) for more information.

inputs.name: regionName
inputs.label: OCI Region
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The OCI region code (us-east-1, us-west-2 etc) of the region containing the OCI resource(s) the task will use or create. For more information see [OCI Regions and Endpoints](https://docs.OCI.Oracle.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html).

If a region is not explicitly configured the task will attempt to obtain the region to be used from the following sources:

* From a task variable named _OCI.Region_.
* From the standard OCI environment variable _OCI_REGION_ in the build agent's environment.
*  If the build agent is running on an Oracle EC2 instance, from instance metadata associated with the EC2 instance.

__Note:__ The regions listed in the picker are those known at the time this software was released. New regions that are not listed may still be used by entering the _region code_ of the region (for example _us_west_2_).

inputs.name: stackName
inputs.label: Stack Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the stack to delete.

inputs.name: logRequest
inputs.label: Log Request
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, the response metadata and body content of non-streaming responses from calls to OCI services are output to the task's debug log. The unique request ID, which can be useful when contacting OCI for support, is always logged to the task output regardless of this option setting.

inputs.name: logResponse
inputs.label: Log Response
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set the body data of non-streaming responses returned by OCI service calls are output to the task's debug log.
